rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual economic data ('reach up to', 'continues to demand') without high-potency framing.
The segment uses a future verb ('will reach') with scale ('5.3 million tons'), but Q3 requires realised impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports projections and demand but contains no explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with scale contrast for reassurance.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Describes hopeful future possibilities/projections ('exports will reach up to 5.3 million tons').
